|- wi(wa(wbr(c0, cfv(ceupth, c1), c2), wcel(c3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c0)))), wss(cpr(cfv(c2, c3), cfv(c2, co(c3, caddc, nat1))), cfv(c4, cfv(c0, c3))))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c1))

comment: The ` N ` -th edge in an eulerian path is the edge having ` P ( N ) ` and ` P ( N + 1 ) ` as endpoints . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by AV, 18-Feb-2021.)
